segments.text: I see the water just spilling over the edge of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is getting wet, but she’s still polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the children are smarter than she is right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on those cookies, he doesn’t even notice the stool shaking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm the garden looks outside while the kitchen is a mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading fast, and soon the whole floor will be soaked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the girl is going to get wet—it’s all going to end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to step in before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
